items.title: Nitin Jain quits OfBusiness to start manufacturing venture
items.summary:
- *Nitin Jain*, cofounder and CBO of *OfBusiness* and its lending arm *Oxyzo*, is quitting to start a manufacturing-focused venture, announced on LinkedIn.
- He had previously stepped down as CBO and later rejoined amid negotiations with investors for his new venture.
- *OfBusiness*, founded in 2015, posted 2023-24 growth and last raised funding in 2021 with a **$325M** round led by **Alpha Wave Global**, **Tiger Global**, and **SoftBank Vision Fund**.

items.title: Indian Railways nears complete electrification; hits 99.2% of broad gauge network, ahead of UK, Russia & China
India trusted supplier of quality medicines: Rajesh Agrawal
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- India is a *trusted global supplier* of quality and affordable medicines, with exports crossing **$30 billion** in the last fiscal. 
- It is the world's third largest pharma producer by volume, reaching over *200 markets*, with the US at about **34%** and Europe around **19%** of exports. 
- The domestic market is about *$60 billion*, expected to reach *$130 billion* by 2030, signaling strong *long-term growth*.

items.title: NTPC adds ~360 MW solar; group hits 85.5 GW
items.summary:
- NTPC added **359.585 MW** of solar capacity via subsidiaries in Gujarat and Rajasthan, taking group commercial capacity to **85.541 GW**.
- CODs include **243.66 MW** at Khavda-I (Gujarat), **78 MW** at Nokh (Rajasthan), and **37.925 MW** from Khavda Solar Energy Project (Gujarat).
- NTPC targets **60 GW** renewables by 2032, accounts for about one-quarter of India's power, with **30.9 GW** under construction including **13.3 GW** renewables.

items.title: Green manufacturing a business imperative
items.summary:
- *Green manufacturing* is a business imperative for *Tamil Nadu*’s competitiveness, highlighted by experts at an MCC&I seminar.
- The event notes UK–TN collaboration on climate action, a green rating framework, offshore wind, and heat resilience initiatives.
- Government support includes a 25% capital subsidy for green tech, energy audits, and guidance for MSMEs on carbon footprints and the circular economy.

items.title: SpiceJet orders 100 Natilus jets in India entry
items.summary:
- SpiceJet has ordered 100 **Natilus** blended-wing jets as it marks entry into India and launches a local subsidiary.
- Natilus is considering India for a manufacturing facility to build roughly 300 **HORIZON** jets, with Natilus India headquartered in Mumbai.
- SpiceJet will work with Natilus to secure certification in India and source components locally once regulatory hurdles are cleared.

items.title: Titagarh wins ₹273cr RBMV contract with Indian Railways
items.summary:
- TRSL wins a ₹273.24-crore contract from **Indian Railways** to design, manufacture, supply, test and commission *Rail Borne Maintenance Vehicles (RBMV)*.
- It marks TRSL's maiden entry into the safety and signalling segment, with **training** and ongoing maintenance support for Indian Railways.
- The RBMV on-track machines are for inspection, maintenance and restoration of railway infrastructure, integrating advanced systems for track work and OHE to boost safety and reliability.

items.title: Vedanta plans to invest $20 billion in India in 4-5 years: Anil Agarwal
India to have at least 5 indigenous SMRs
items.author: Atul Mathur
items.summary:
- India aims to deploy at least five indigenously designed *SMRs* by 2033, led by the *Bhabha Atomic Research Centre*. 
- The government has allocated **₹20,000 crore** in the 2025-26 budget for SMR research, design, development, and deployment. 
- India currently has 8.78 GW of capacity and aims to reach about **100 GW** by 2047, with *NPCIL* expanding capacity through collaborations.

items.title: Explained: The Nuclear Energy Bill, 2025 — safety, liability and the push for 100 GW
Attero to invest ₹150-crore for capacity expansion
items.author: Muntazir Abbas
items.summary:
*- Attero to invest **₹150 crore** to add 100,000 tonnes per year, taking total capacity to **244,000 tpa** and adding about **800 jobs**.*
*- Expansion across four sites — **Pune, Bengaluru, Faridabad and Jaipur** — with a focus on **robotics, automation** and **advanced recovery tech**, supported by the Greater Noida R&D Centre.*
*- Revenue grew to **₹1,000 crore** in FY2025 from **₹440 crore** in FY2024, with plans for international **dismantling & Li-ion battery recycling** facilities and patent-backed growth.*

items.title: Ambrane opens Haryana plant; ₹50cr investment, 200% capacity
items.summary:
- **Ambrane** has started operations at an 83,000 sq ft automated manufacturing facility in Kundli, Haryana, built with ₹50cr investment.
- The new plant is set to boost production by **200%** and support entry into *IT peripherals* and small appliances.
- About 600+ workers are employed locally, with ongoing skill development and planned hiring in R&D, quality and manufacturing.

items.title: Tatas bet big on iPhone, infuse ₹1,500 crore more in electronics business
Satcom firms must secure clearances before launch: Scindia
items.author: Himanshi Lohchab, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- Satellite-communication operators will need to secure *security clearances* and host international gateways in India before commercial services go live.
- The policy framework is in place, with next steps on *spectrum assignment* and *security compliance* before licensed operators launch.
- Three licences have been issued to Starlink, OneWeb and Reliance, with DoT spectrum allocation and TRAI pricing framework to follow.

items.title: India–Oman FTA to boost autos, textiles, renewables: Goyal
items.author: ETAuto Desk
items.summary:
- The India–Oman FTA aims to unlock opportunities across sectors including **autos**, **textiles**, **renewables** and more, boosting trade and logistics ties.
- Goyal says the pact will position Oman as a gateway to the **GCC**, eastern Europe, central Asia and Africa, with the signing expected in Muscat in PM Modi's presence.
- Indian investments in Oman have more than tripled since 2020 to about **$5 billion**, and bilateral trade stood around **$10.5 billion** in 2024-25.

items.title: Gadkari urges localisation over imports in auto sector
items.author: ETAuto Desk
items.summary:
- Gadkari urged automakers to boost *localisation* and improve *manufacturing quality*, saying Indian auto components are competitively priced and meet global standards, attracting global carmakers.
- He noted India is increasingly used as an export base by global automakers, with the two-wheeler sector shipping nearly 50% of production overseas and a similar trend in passenger vehicles.
- He linked the sector to urban environmental goals, citing around *40%* of pollution from vehicular emissions and calling for cleaner technologies and higher domestic value addition.

items.title: ELITe taps Toyo for Infinite Loop India project
items.summary: - *ELITe* awards the detailed engineering contract for its Infinite Loop India facility to *Toyo Engineering India*.\n- The deal follows front-end design by *Tata Consulting Engineers* and includes detailed design, procurement engineering and technical documentation.\n- The plant aims for *70,000 tpa of recycled PET resin* with *Nike* as anchor customer, targeting completion by end-2027.

items.title: Powerplay crosses 40,000 construction firms on its platform
Transforming Indian manufacturing with the power of the comprehensive digital twin
Allcargo expands domestic network to cover 100% PIN codes
items.summary:
- *Allcargo Extended Reach (AER)* replaces ESS and expands coverage from ~21,000 to >32,000 PIN codes, and from ~4,900 to >10,000 directly serviceable codes.
- The rollout uses *AI‑driven planning*, *intelligent routing*, and fully digital workflows, extending services to Tier II–IV towns and remote regions such as Port Blair, Ladakh, Jammu & Kashmir, the Western Ghats, and the Northeastern states.
- The move supports *MSMEs* and the *digital economy*, reinforcing India’s shift to a formal, consumption‑led economy with a nationwide express & distribution network.

items.title: EMC 2.0: 1.80 lakh electronics jobs
items.summary:
- EMC 2.0 aims to generate about *1.80 lakh* jobs and attract over ₹*1.46 lakh crore* investment across 10 states, with *11 clusters* and *2 common facility centres* approved, and each cluster setting aside at least *10%* for ready-made factory buildings.
- *123 manufacturers* have committed ₹*1,13,000 crore*; *nine units* have started production, spending ₹*12,569.69 crore*, currently employing about *13,680* people.
- Independent study notes improved supply chains, lower logistics costs, enhanced skill development, and significant direct/indirect employment within the cluster ecosystem, supported by *plug-and-play* facilities and roughly ₹*2,492.74 crore* in government assistance.

items.title: SED's LTE ZLD systems at Coca-Cola plants in Jammu
items.summary:
- SED installed *LTE ZLD* at two Coca-Cola bottling plants in Jammu using **MVR** to treat wastewater at 60–65°C, cutting energy to ~13–15 kWh/m3.
- Output includes reusable condensate water and recovery of solids like *salts and sugars* for material reuse; compact, *modular design* avoids RO/boilers/cooling towers, enabling rapid deployment.
- Samba (NJ Food LLP) and Kathua (Kandhari Beverages) achieved **zero liquid discharge** without conventional ETPs.

items.title: Liebherr shifts India focus from luxury kitchens to labs, eyes scientific refrigeration launch in 2026
NTPC Green Energy: 243.66 MW Khavda-I solar
items.summary:
- NTPC Green Energy has declared commercial operation for **243.66 MW** of the **Khavda-I Solar PV Project** in **Gujarat**. 
- The COD is under CPSU Scheme Phase-II, Tranche-III, boosting NGEL’s capacity to **7,889.335 MW** and NTPC’s total to **85,503 MW**. 
- This milestone reinforces NTPC’s push for **utility-scale renewable installations** and supports India’s transition to a **low-carbon** power mix.

items.title: L&T wins ₹2,500–5,000 cr EPC orders across India
items.summary:
- *L&T Buildings & Factories* won several EPC orders across India, spanning *tourism infrastructure*, sports facilities and residential projects.
- The awards include Advait Lok (Acharya Shankar Museum Complex) in Omkareshwar and the R G Baruah Sports Complex in Guwahati, with delivery timelines of 27–36 months.
- These contracts fall in L&T’s internal large-contract band of ₹2,500–₹5,000 crore.

items.title: OpenAI in talks to raise $10B from Amazon
items.summary: - OpenAI is in early talks to raise at least $10B from *Amazon* and use its *Trainium* chips, potentially valuing OpenAI north of **$500B**.\n- The talks are preliminary; a deal would boost Amazon's fledgling semiconductor unit as it competes with **Nvidia** for AI chips.\n- The move follows a prior AWS deal for **$38B** of cloud power using Nvidia GPUs, while *Microsoft* holds a large stake in OpenAI; negotiations began around October.

items.title: Suzlon bags 306 MW wind turbine orders from Yanara in Rajasthan
Attero to invest ₹150 crore for capacity expansion
items.author: Muntazir Abbas
items.summary:
- Attero plans a ₹150 crore investment to boost e-waste recycling capacity by 1 lakh tonnes per year and *nearly double* its workforce by adding about 800 jobs.
- The expansion will cover four sites in *Pune*, *Bengaluru*, *Faridabad* and a copper-refining plant in *Jaipur*, lifting total capacity to *2,44,000 tonnes*.
- With revenue rising from ₹440 crore in FY2024 to ₹1,000 crore in FY2025, Attero aims to advance *automation*, *robotics*, and *Li-ion battery recycling*, and pursue international facilities.

items.title: Tembo Global Industries commissions new Vasai manufacturing facility
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- *Tembo Global Industries* commissioned a new facility in *Vasai*, Maharashtra, to boost production capacity to around *90,000 MTPA*. 
- The 3.32-acre greenfield site consolidates three units into a single 250,000 sq ft plant designed for future *capacity expansion* and improved *logistics*. 
- It will manufacture industrial metal products, including *pipe support systems*, fasteners, HVAC and anti-vibration systems, signaling Tembo's growth strategy per MD *Sanjay J Patel*.

items.title: Odisha pharma policy to draw ₹25k cr by 2030
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- The Odisha govt launched Pharmaceutical and Medical Devices Policy-2025 to attract **₹25,000 crore** investment and create **1 lakh jobs** by 2030.
- It offers subsidies including **50% land-cost subsidy** for units with 200+ Odisha-domiciled skilled staff, **30% capex subsidy**, and **25% power-infrastructure subsidy**.
- The policy aims to establish the **Odisha Pharma Park** and **Odisha MedTech Park**, boosting APIs, vaccines, diagnostics, wearables, and R&D through industry-academia skilling.

items.title: Apple explores chip assembly talks with Indian manufacturers
Amitabh Kant to join ITC board as independent director
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary: - *Amitabh Kant* has been approved as an *independent director* of ITC Ltd for five years, effective January 1, 2026.\n- He brings four decades of experience in *public policy* and administration, including roles like *G20 Sherpa* and former *CEO of NITI Aayog*.\n- The move expands ITC's board with a veteran policy leader who serves on other boards such as *HCL Technologies*, *Larsen & Toubro*, and *InterGlobe Aviation*.

items.title: JSW Energy to set up wind turbine blade units in Karnataka & Gujarat
items.author: Kalpana Pathak
items.summary:
- **JSW Energy** is setting up two wind turbine blade units in **Karnataka** and **Gujarat** to produce blades for **JSW Energy** and **Sany Renewable Energy** under a technology licensing deal. 
- Karnataka would have 3–4 moulds producing 400–500 blades annually, while Gujarat would have 2–3 moulds for about 300 blades per year, with an initial investment around **$50 million**. 
- As of November 2025, **JSW Energy**'s installed capacity stood at 13,295 MW.

items.title: General Catalyst to ramp up investments in manufacturing, AI
Krishna Bhaskar takes charge as CMD of Singareni Collieries
items.summary:
- *D Krishna Bhaskar*, a 2012-batch IAS officer, assumed charge as *CMD of Singareni Collieries Company Limited (SCCL)*, Telangana's state-run coal miner.
- The *Telangana government* appointed him after incumbent *N Balaram* returned to his parent cadre, and Bhaskar currently serves as CMD of *Transmission Corporation of Telangana (Transco)*.
- *SCCL* is jointly owned by the *Telangana government* and the Union government in a 51:49 equity structure, making it one of the country’s major coal mining companies.

items.title: ReNew-Google pact for 150-MW Rajasthan solar project
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- ReNew Energy Global Plc partners with **Google** to develop a **150 MW solar project** in *Rajasthan*, with Google procuring the project's energy attributes including carbon credits.
- The project, slated for commissioning in *2026*, is expected to generate around **425,000 MWh** annually, powering about *360,000 households*, expanding ReNew's clean-energy portfolio to **2.7 GW**.
- The deal supports India's energy transition and corporate sustainability goals, reinforcing decarbonisation through scalable, long-term renewable solutions.

items.title: AI boom lifts chipmaking equipment to $126B
items.summary:
- SEMI forecasts a rise of about **9%** to **$126B** in 2026 and **7.3%** to **$135B** in 2027, driven by *AI*-enabled capacity expansions. 
- Asia remains the top market, with China, Taiwan and South Korea investing in leading-edge and AI-related memory chips, while **ASML** stays the biggest supplier. 
- Other regions are also expected to lift spending in 2026–27 thanks to government incentives, regionalization and targeted specialty capacity expansions.

items.title: Chipmaking equipment sales to hit $126B in 2026
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- The SEMI forecast projects chipmaking equipment spending to rise about *9%* to **$126 billion** in 2026, and **7.3%** to **$135 billion** in 2027, as AI-driven capacity expansion boosts demand.
- *Asia-Pacific* remains the dominant market, with *China, Taiwan, and South Korea* likely to stay on top through 2027, with China investing the most overall.
- **ASML**, the biggest supplier with about a quarter of sales, is followed by **Applied Materials**, **KLA Corp**, **Lam Research** and **Tokyo Electron**.

items.title: Commercial semiconductor production expected in coming weeks: MeitY's S Krishnan
National flag manufacturing centre awaits R-Day orders
items.summary:
- *KKGSS* in Bengeri, Hubballi, the country's only national-flag maker, has not received fresh orders for the 77th Republic Day in Jan 2026 as changes to the *National Flag Code* impact procurement.
- The centre has stocked flags worth over ₹2 crore after pre-producing various sizes, but bulk orders usually arrive by early December yet remain absent nearly two weeks into the month.
- Officials say the relaxation permitting polyester flags and the amended code have harmed livelihoods; they urge the Union government to revise the code while artisans pivot to alternative products to stay employed.

items.title: India Inc: 9% salary hikes in 2026
items.author: Brinda Sarkar; ET Bureau
items.summary:
- The *average salary increase* for India in 2026 is projected at **9%**, with *manufacturing* and *automotive* leading at **9.5%**.
- Mercer’s survey of over 1,500 companies highlights a shift toward *short-term incentives* and cost discipline to attract/retain talent.
- Hiring intentions are cooling and attrition is stabilizing, signaling a cautious growth path for the year.

items.title: Tesla boosts German gigafactory battery cell investments
items.summary:
- Tesla plans to produce up to *8 GWh/year* of battery cells at the *Gruenheide* site starting in 2027, backed by a **three-digit million euro** investment.
- The project aims to create end-to-end production—from cells to vehicles—at a single site, enhancing **supply-chain resilience** in Europe.
- The *Gruenheide plant* employs about *11,500* staff and remains Europe’s only Tesla gigafactory, with potential to house the entire battery value chain on site in the future.

items.title: Vedanta gets NCLT nod for demerger plan
items.summary:
- The *NCLT* granted sanction to Vedanta's demerger plan, enabling the split of its metals-to-oil conglomerate into sector-specific entities.
- The MoPNG raised concerns about financial risks post-demerger and alleged misrepresentation of assets and liabilities, while Vedanta said it had complied.
- Vedanta's shares rose about *3.5%* following the news, signaling market reaction.

items.title: Domestic firms may chip in for the iPhone
Centre notifies ₹7,280 crore scheme to boost rare earth magnet manufacturing
Digantara raises $50 mn in Series B for global expansion
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- **Digantara** has raised **$50 million** in a *Series B* round led by 360 ONE Asset, SBI Investments Co Japan, and Ronnie Screwvala.
- The fresh capital will fuel *global expansion* beyond the US, fund production facilities for optical systems and satellites, and double *R&D* teams.
- **Digantara** aims to become a full-stack *space surveillance and intelligence* company, planning 15 *space surveillance satellites* and two *missile-warning satellites* by 2026–27.

items.title: Mexico shows how global supply chains are shifting; capability is key: Moglix’s Rahul Garg
India aims 5 MMT green hydrogen by 2030
items.summary: - Green hydrogen production capacity is expected to reach **5 MMT per annum by 2030**, as stated in a *Rajya Sabha* reply by **Shripad Yesso Naik**.\n- Under the **National Green Hydrogen Mission** (NGHM), India aims to be a global hub for production, use and export of green hydrogen and its derivatives.\n- Incentives under **MNRE**: 18 companies for 862,000 tpa; 15 firms for 3,000 MW p.a. electrolyser capacity with ₹4,440 crore incentives; ISTS charge exemption for plants commissioned by 31 Dec 2030 for 25 years.

items.title: Amitabh Kant to join ITC board as independent director
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- ITC shareholders approved Amitabh Kant's appointment as an *independent director* for a five-year term starting January 1, 2026.
- Kant, a former IAS officer and ex‑NITI Aayog CEO, brings *public policy* and administration experience and served as India's *G20 Sherpa* in 2022–23.
- He currently serves on the boards of *HCL Technologies*, *Larsen & Toubro*, and *InterGlobe Aviation*, highlighting governance in ITC's FMCG ecosystem.

items.title: The customer-first decisions that shaped Maruti’s competitive advantage
